results.title: Gertrud
results.creator_credit: Carl Theodor Dreyer and Palladium Films
results.brief_description: Adapted from a long-forgotten play by Hjalmar Soderberg written during the early years of the 20th century, Dreyer’s controversial last film centres on a proud, stubborn woman who demands total commitment in love and forsakes both her husband and a former lover for a young musician who is relatively indifferent to her. The film moves at a slow, theatrical pace with long takes recorded mainly in direct sound (though shot principally in a studio), and deserves to be ranked along with ‘The Magnificent Ambersons, ‘Lola Montes’, and ‘The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance’ as one of the great haunted-memory films. Its meaning hinges partially on the refusal or inability to compromise and what this implies over the range of an entire life (in this case Dreyer’s as well as his heroine’s). The heroine may be regarded as a monster, a sublime and saintly martyr, or most likely an impossible fusion of the two. Dreyer’s film has a similarly dialectical and contradictory effect—at once narrative and (in the figure of Gertrud herself) nonnarrative, static and flowing, a tribute to free will and a positing of the unconscious as tragic destiny. Reference: Jonathan Rosenbaum. Chicago Online Reader.http://onfilm.chireader.com/MovieCaps/G/GE/03973_GERTRUD.html Cast includes Nina Pens Rode, Bendt Rothe, Ebbe Robe, Baard Owe and Axel Strobye. Note: Adapted from the play by Hjalmar Soderberg. In Danish with English subtitles.

results.title: George of the jungle
results.creator_credit: Sam Weisman, Jon Avnet, Jordan Kerner, David Hoberman, Mandeville Films and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the cartoon series, “George of the jungle” is an action/comedy version of the characters created by Jay Ward. George (Brendan Fraser) is lost to the jungle as a young boy and is subsequently raised by apes and other jungle creatures. As George grows to manhood it transpires that he is a brave but none too bright young man. An intrepid American woman, Ursula Stanhope, travels to the jungle to satisfy her longing for adventurous experiences. Stanhope’s snobbish boorish fiancee follows her to the jungle and becomes embroiled in a tug-of-war with George for Stanhopes’ affection. But can George leave his gentle animal family for the urban jungle of San Francisco? The comedy is broad and slapstick in style, with Fraser revelling in the pratfalls of the lead role. Also featuring the voice of John Cleese (as Ape the ape) and 1970s blaxploitation icon Richard Roundtree.

results.title: Genevieve
results.brief_description: A captivating British comedy about two couples, classic-car enthusiasts, who, after participating in the annual London to Brighton rally challenge each other to a friendly race. Their playfulness becomes increasingly intense as they speed to the Westminster Bridge finish line. Larry Adler received an Academy Award nomination for his memorable harmonica score. Cast: Dinah Sheridan, John Gregson, Kay Kendall, Kenneth More, Geoffrey Keen, Reginald Beckwith, Arthur Wontner, Joyce Grenfell.

results.title: Gendernauts
results.brief_description: Gendernauts explores avant-garde concepts of gender fluidity amongst a diverse group of people in the San Francisco bay area, focusing on the ways these “gender cyborgs” have transgressed conventional perceptions through altering their minds and bodies with hormone and surgical treatments. Underground documentary maker Monika Treut boldly leads the viewer into a brave new world where biological women use testosterone to achieve maleness, where men have surgery to become women, and where some men and women are content to exist on the boundaries of gender as intersexuals. Media and gender theorist Sandy Stone provides a thought-provoking commentary as Treut deconstructs assumptions about gender by delving into the life experiences of sex artist Annie Sprinkle, author and transgender theorist Susan Stryker, video artist Texas Tomboy, author Max Wolf Valerio, photographer Stafford, net artist Jordy Jones, former centrefold model Tornado, and self-confessed intersexual Hida Vilario. Juxtaposed with footage from inside drag king bar Club Confidential, and the transgender-friendly Tom Waddell Clinic, these subjects openly discuss their backgrounds, sexuality and fascination with gender bending, revealing just how constrictive traditional observations about the dual nature of gender have been. Excerpts from films such as Annie Sprinkle’s Linda, Les, and Annie (1990), Texas Tomboy’s Alienator (1997), Monika Treut’s Max (1992), Jordy Jones’ Injectible Man (1998), and Shu Lea Cheang’s web feature Brandon (1998) are also interspersed with the interview footage. This documentary had its world premiere at the Berlin International Film Festival Panorama in February 1999.

results.title: Gateway to Asia
results.brief_description: With the distance between Canada and Russia, China and India cut by high-speed planes, new international links are being forged. In this Pacific world, British Columbia is a unit of growing importance. In a brief survey of the province, Gateway to Asia covers the people, natural resources, industries, and some of the social problems of British Columbia. Located on the Pacific Coast, it is the jumping-off place for planes bound for the Orient and Russia, and a vital link between the rest of Canada and her neighbors in the Far East. Narrated by Lorne Greene.

results.title: Gang related
results.creator_credit: Jim Kouf, John Bertolli, Steve Stabler, Brad Krevoy and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Notorious for being rapper turned actor Tupac Shakur’s final film appearance before being gunned down in 1996, ‘Gang related’ is a tense crime drama about corruption, gangs and drugs. Detectives Divinci (James Belushi) and Rodriguez (Tupac Shakur) are two bent street detectives with a flourishing byline drug scam which involves Divinci’s girlfriend, Cynthia (Lela Rochon) as bait. The partners have vastly different motivations behind their actions - Divinci wants to retire while Rodriguez has a gambling debt to repay. Both are united by their belief that the men they kill deserve it. Their plan quickly unravels when one of the punters turns out to be an undercover D.E.A. and they are not able to wash their hands as cleanly for the murder with their usual “gang-related” dismissal. Cast also includes James Earl Jones, David Paymer and Wendy Crewson. Includes bonus footage including the last ever interview with Tupac Shakur.

results.title: Gabbeh
results.creator_credit: Mohsen Makhmalbaf, Khalil Mahmoudi, Khalil Daroudchi, MK2 Productions and Sanayeh Dasti
results.brief_description: With “Gabbeh” Mohsen Makhmalbaf creates a romantic parable of universal resonance. A gabbeh is an Iranian carpet produced by the nomadic Ghashghai tribe of southern Iran. This episodic tale is framed with exquisite interludes on the colours of nature, painting each scene with landscapes and vistas of breathtaking beauty.

results.title: Funny bones
results.creator_credit: Peter Chelsom, Simon Fields and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Tommy Fawkes (Oliver Platt), is a struggling stand-up comedian trying to live up to the legacy that his famous father George Fawkes (Jerry Lewis) has created. George is now retired, and Tommy is struggling to get his career started. After yet another painful failure onstage, Tommy decides to travel back to Blackpool, England, where his family’s history and comedy originated and during his stay, Tommy discovers some not so funny secrets about his family and his past. During this time he develops a peculiar friendship with the mysterious Jack Parker (Lee Evans), the seemingly dim, comedian-savant. This film, a “black slapstick comedy” goes beyond any genre, utilizing brilliant psychological and physical performances right down to the eyebrow raising cameo from Oliver Reed. Written by Peter Chelsom and Peter Flannery.

results.title: Fun in Acapulco
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: While in Acapulco, Elvis is pretty busy employed as a boat hand, lifeguard, and singer. He’s managed to capture the attention of a few of the local beauties (Ursula Andress, Elsa Cardenas), which fills in most of the spare time he has. He harbours a secret fear of heights however, after a fatal mishap during his career as a trapeze catcher leaves him shaken. Love manage to inspires him to overcome his fear of heights in the most public way possible - diving off a 136 foot cliff. Features the following songs: “Bossa Nova baby”, “You can’t say no in Acapulco”.

results.title: Full alert
results.creator_credit: Ringo Lam, Li Kuo-Hsing, Brilliant Idea Group and Young Filmmakers
results.brief_description: After the failure of his first Hollywood film, ‘Maximum Risk’, Lam returned to Hong Kong to shoot this $13 million action film. A claustrophobic police thriller set just after the handover of Hong Kong to China, ‘Full Alert’ revives the ‘film bleu’ tradition of Hong Kong cop and gangster films, its belligerent energy recalling the sense of anarchy in Hong Kong films of the eighties. Inspector Pao is a grizzled, jaded veteran cop who has seen it all in his years with the Hong Kong police. After a vicious murderer escapes to Taiwan, Pau vows to track him down. To him he represents a new kind of criminal— smart, canny, ambitious and vicious— a man who will stop at nothing to get what he wants. As in Michael Mann’s ‘Heat’ (1996) to which ‘Full Alert’ has been compared, the cop and the robber are set up as a pair of compelling twins/opposites driven to battle each other. They increasingly come to resemble each other in motive and character as the film progresses. Cast includes Lau Ching-Wan and Francis Ng. In Cantonese with English and Mandarin subtitles.

Inspector Pao is a grizzled, jaded veteran cop who has seen it all in his years with the Hong Kong police. After a vicious murderer escapes to Taiwan, Pau vows to track him down. To him he represents a new kind of criminal— smart, canny, ambitious and vicious— a man who will stop at nothing to get what he wants. As in Michael Mann’s ‘Heat’ (1996) to which ‘Full Alert’ has been compared, the cop and the robber are set up as a pair of compelling twins/opposites driven to battle each other. They increasingly come to resemble each other in motive and character as the film progresses. Cast includes Lau Ching-Wan and Francis Ng. In Cantonese with English and Mandarin subtitles.
